title: Benefits and Costs of Knowledge and Technology Transfer: A Panel Data Analysis
abstractText:
This project aims at creating a dataset that enables the documentation and quantitative analysis of the evolution of research output and knowledge and technology transfer measures in the UK. The project will measure the dynamic impact of industry collaboration on individual research output. Specifically it will address the concerns that have received the most public and scholarly attention:

  • Do inventors and researchers with collaborative links with the private sector publish less than their peers without such links ("reduced productivity problem")?
  • Do high levels of industry collaboration increase or decrease basic and applied research output ("skewing problem")?
  • Does patenting influence academic output by delaying the publication of research findings ("secrecy problem")?

This project will also address some of the dynamic implications of university and government practices and policies.
